org.gearvrf

Class GVRColliderGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRComponent
        • org.gearvrf.GVRCollider
          • org.gearvrf.GVRColliderGroup

  • public class GVRColliderGroup
extends GVRCollider
    Holds any number of GVRCollider instances Ray casting is computationally expensive. Rather than probing the entire scene graph, GVRF requires you to mark parts of the scene as "pickable" by adding their meshes (or, more cheaply if less precisely, their bounding box) to a GVRCollider; GVRSceneObject.attachCollider(GVRCollider) attaching that collider to a scene object; and setting the collider's enabled flag. One can use this class to specify multiple colliders for a single GVRSceneObject.

    • Method Detail

      • getEnable

        public boolean getEnable()
        Deprecated. use GVRComponent.isEnabled()
        Is this collider-group enabled? If this collider-group is disabled, then picking will not occur against its GVRColliders.
        Returns:
        true if enabled, false otherwise.

      • addCollider

        public void addCollider(GVRCollider collider)
        Add a GVRCollider to this collider-group
        Parameters:
        collider - The GVRCollider to add

      • removeCollider

        public void removeCollider(GVRCollider collider)
        Remove a GVRCollider from this collider-group. No exception is thrown if the collider is not held by this collider-group.
        Parameters:
        collider - The GVRCollider to remove

      • getHit

        public float[] getHit()
        Get the x, y, z of the point of where the hit occurred in model space
        Returns:
        Three floats representing the x, y, z hit point.

        getHit()
